revised_title: Hyperasymptotics: A New Approach to Asymptotic Expansions
tldr: The authors develop a technique called hyperasymptotics to improve the accuracy of asymptotic expansions for solutions of ordinary differential equations. They use a resurgence formula to systematically reduce the exponentially small remainder and create a nested sequence of asymptotic series. This technique is particularly useful for approximating solutions of the one-dimensional Helmholtz equation and can lead to ultimate approximations with errors smaller than the square of the original superasymptotic remainder.
